refnamediv.refpurpose: Output a message and terminate the current script

refsect1.title: Description

note.simpara: This is not a real function, but a language construct.

refsect1.simpara: The exit function terminates execution of the script. It prints status just before exiting.
If status is an integer, that value will also be used as the exit status. Exit statuses should be in the range 1 to 254, the exit status 255 is reserved by PHP and shall not be used.

note.simpara: PHP version >= 4.2.0 does NOT print the status if it is an integer.
The die function is an alias for exit.

example.title: exit example
example.programlisting:
<?php

$filename = '/path/to/data-file';
$file = fopen ($filename, 'r')
    or exit("unable to open file ($filename)");

?>
